;

;The first orthopedic equipment was even brought by Chen Xiulun himself, and other equipment was purchased later. Facts have proved Chen Xiulun’s judgment. After the establishment of the Department of Orthopedics, there has never been a shortage of patients. Other doctors also referred patients with orthopedics-related diseases to Chen Xiulun. Patients who had been missed or transferred before stayed in the hospital, and the referral rate increased from the past. of 100% dropped to 30%-40%.

;

;This is what the "Hundred Chief Health Experts Go to the Grassroots Plan" most hopes to see - to build a specialty specialty and develop more than one new business and new Technology, "pass, help and lead" to create a professional team.

;

;Chen Jianping, a professor at Guangzhou Medical University, is one of the first batch of grassroots experts. After retirement, he built a rehabilitation department in Liantan Health Center as a "second venture". When he first joined the job, the hospital lacked equipment and could only spend 300,000 yuan for Chen Jianping to buy consumables. He made simple rehabilitation consumables by himself. Today, the Rehabilitation Department of Liantan Health Center is able to carry out 58 items of 6 categories of appropriate traditional Chinese medicine rehabilitation techniques, and the annual number of rehabilitation treatment patients has increased from about 10,000 in 2017 to 40,000 in 2022.

;

;"We most hope that the experts will leave their skills to us. This is the cost of eating." Compared with outpatient visits, Ye Bizhen, Secretary of Liuhuang Health Center He told Southern Weekend reporters that in the final analysis, the hospital still wants to obtain the expertise of experts.

;

;Statistical results from the Guangdong Provincial Health Commission show that after the first batch of plans, 65.2% of central health centers established services including gynecology and gynecology with the help of chief experts. Obstetrics, traditional Chinese medicine, pediatrics, general surgery, gastroenterology and other specialties.

;

;Zeng Zhongbo, a cardiovascular medicine expert hired by Lantang Health Center, previously practiced at Huizhou First People's Hospital, which is only more than an hour's drive from Lantang Health Center. It is hoped that he can guide the management of hypertension and diabetes, bring new technologies and treatments, and add a special specialty on cardiovascular disease in the future.

;

;Zhang Fengyun described his idea to Southern Weekend reporters: in the first three months, doctors will be familiar with breast surgery, and in the next three months, they can start simple breast surgery. Suturing, and after half a year of further training, we strive to gradually separate the breast department from surgery. Only with professionalism can patients trust me. "Breast surgery costs less and does not require complex equipment, so it is very suitable as a new specialty."

;

;Doctors are a profession that is always learning. Yan Xinzheng found that grassroots doctors usually accumulated experience in consultation and lacked systematic theoretical training. He planned to organize common diseases in rural areas, such as hypertension and diabetes, into several 30-minute mini-lessons to train young doctors.

;

;Ding Shengwen hopes to slowly transplant the work style of large hospitals to Yangcun Health Center. He requires doctors to come to the hospital half an hour early one day a week and brings training materials from the original unit to the doctors. Lecture, "Young people are good at editing surgical videos and looking up information, but they need a little push to form a habit."

;Su Haijin, who usually loves to show off his wealth and travels in a high profile, finally played "out of the blue" Circled."

;

;On the morning of August 15, 2023, after hearing the call of his eldest son, Su Haijin jumped from the balcony on the second floor and fell into the backyard of the villa.

;

;Eight Singaporean law enforcement officers found him beside the drain behind the villa. In the photos released by the Singapore police, Su Haijin was only wearing short-sleeved shorts and bare feet. The leg was also broken.

;

;Su Haijin, whose ancestral home is Anxi, Fujian, settled in Singapore in 2017. "He is not tall, speaks with a Hokkien accent, lives in a mansion in Bukit Timah, and is picked up and dropped off by a Rolls-Royce." described the author of "Singapore Eyes" who has met Su Haijin.

;

;Singapore court records show that Su Haijin and Wu Qin married in 2019. At first, the family lived in the Gramercy Residence duplex near Orchard Road, and soon rented a villa at Yoho Gardens in Bukit Timah, Singapore. The latter’s monthly rent is as high as 80,000 Singapore dollars (equivalent to over 400,000 yuan in RMB).

;

;This villa is surrounded by green trees, and few people can see the home from the outside.

;

;"His villa is like a recreation room, with a mini golf course in the courtyard and a karaoke OK in the basement." An insider told Singapore's Lianhe Zaobao.

;

;Su Haijin behaves like a boss. In recent years, he has done a lot of "business" in Xiamen, China and Cambodia. Su Haijin is also a member of Sentosa Golf Club in Singapore. Active Golf Services, a golf membership service agency, revealed that Sentosa Golf Club is the most expensive golf club in Singapore, with foreign membership fees as high as S$1 million.

;

;Su Haijin’s luxurious life was suspended on August 15.

;

;On this day, more than 400 Singapore police officers also arrested 9 other foreigners, including Su Baolin (41 years old), Su Jianfeng (35 years old), Zhang Ruijin (44 years old), Lin Baoying (43 years old), Wang Shuiming (42 years old), Chen Qingyuan (33 years old), Su Wenqiang (31 years old), Wang Baosen (31 years old) and Wang Dehai (34 years old).

;

;They are accused of money laundering, fraud, online gambling and forgery of documents, etc. They may be relatives, lovers, or partners.

;

;Singapore’s Minister of Home Affairs and Law Shanmugam said in an interview that “this is one of the largest anti-money laundering operations in Singapore.” According to statistics from the Singapore police, the 10 suspects involved in the case amounted to SGD 2.8 billion (equivalent to RMB 14.8 billion). ;;

;

;As of press time, the Singaporean court has not yet accepted the bail request of any suspect due to concerns about the suspect's absconding.

;

;;

;

;The location where the suspect in the money laundering case was arrested

;

;"Money Laundering Case" puzzle

;

;The Singapore police have been preparing for nearly three years to arrest 10 suspects.

;

;"Some documents for forging bank account amounts, suspicious financial reports, etc. were first discovered, and (the Singapore government) launched investigations one by one." October 3, 2023 On the same day, Singapore’s Minister of Communications and Information and Second Minister of Home Affairs Yang Liming said in Parliament.

;

;Suspicious financial reports come from the suspect's corporate transactions, bank deposits, etc.

;

;After moving to Singapore in 2017, Su Haijin spent money like water, buying a house, a yacht, and starting a company.

;

;;

;

;A single-family house on Orchard Road, Singapore. ;(Lou Xiaoxi/Picture);;;

;

;Southern Weekend reporters inquired about Singapore Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA) documents and found that Su Haijin has successively served as CEO of Aihai Investment, Daily Glory International, Yihao Network Technology, Meining (Asia) International E-Commerce and SG-Gree in Singapore. A director or shareholder of a company.

;

;According to Singapore's "Business Times" report, Su Haijin bought two sea-view single-family villas in Cove Drive, Sentosa Island, for S$36.4 million in 2021. , combine them into one building (to avoid the restriction on foreigners owning multiple suites on Sentosa Island).

;

;Also in 2021, the Singapore police detected some suspicious financial activities, such as providing forged documents to banks. In early 2022, the Singapore police launched a comprehensive investigation and targeted a group of related people.

;

;In 2022, the Singapore police will only send a small group of investigators to investigate, so as not to alert the enemy. "If the suspect is aware of it, he may abscond with the money, and the investigation will be in vain." Yang Liming said.

;

;It was not until early 2023 that the Singapore Attorney General's Office assessed that the police had sufficient information and had sufficient reason to suspect that this group of people was suspected of engaging in criminal activities.

;

;So on August 15, the Singapore police dispatched 400 police officers to launch an island-wide arrest operation.

;

;Police believe that 41-year-old Su Baolin and Su Haijin are brothers.

;

;Su Baolin and Su Haijin are both from Anxi, Fujian, and they have close financial ties. An investigation by the Singapore police found that the two properties on Beach Road under Su Haijin's name were purchased by Su Baolin in 2021, with a total price of approximately S$2.285 million.

;

;Su Baolin is also a high-net-worth individual recognized by Singapore real estate website 99.co.

;

;In 2022, Su Baolin, Su Haijin and two other people jointly purchased a yacht with a total price of SGD 5.45 million. The yacht is named "Family", has a total length of 38 meters, can carry 10 passengers, and flies the flag of the South Pacific country Cook Islands.

;

;In early September, a Singaporean court stated that the Family yacht had left Singapore and was currently in Phuket, Thailand.

;

;;

;

;October 2023, Sentosa Cove Marina in the eastern part of Sentosa Island, Singapore. The yacht purchased by Su Haijin and Su Baolin had already left Singapore after the money laundering incident. ;(Lou Xiaoxi/Photo);

;

;But the two men’s lawyers denied the police’s kinship accusations .

;

;However, Southern Weekend reporters discovered that Su Haijin and Su Baolin have close business ties.

;

;Su Baolin is also a shareholder and director of Su Haijin-related companies Meining (Asia) International E-Commerce and SG-Gree. He is also a shareholder of Xinbao Investment Holdings, Xinjiamei Investment Company and Sentosa Project.

;

;As of press time, the money laundering case is still under investigation, and new evidence is still emerging.

;

;After another suspect Su Jianfeng (35 years old) was arrested, the police discovered that he had a total of S$17 million in cash while investigating three insurance institutions. But when the money laundering case was brought to court on October 18, Su Jianfeng changed his story and claimed that the S$17 million was kept for others.

;

;;Opening a company is the first way to launder money;

;

;"10 The financial gains obtained by the suspects through illegal online gambling and Internet fraud are 'black money', and the act of hiding and disguising the source of illegal funds and making the black money appear to be legal is money laundering." Yan Yan, director of the China Anti-Money Laundering Center at Fudan University Lixin explained to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;;

;

;Opening a company is the first way for suspects to launder money. In Singapore, 10 suspects have successively opened investment companies, technology companies, construction contracting companies, etc.

;

;Su Haijin and Su Baolin jointly serve as senior executives of nearly 20 companies. However, most companies are shell companies.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters compiled industrial and commercial records and found that three of them are still in operation. The registered addresses of these three companies are all #15, Suntec City One, Temasek Avenue, Singapore. -02. There is no trace of the registration places of the other 11 companies, and the other six are located in private residences with restricted access.

;

;Su Jianfeng admitted during the confession that he did not know the address of the company An Xing Technology under his name.

;

;In Singapore, foreigners frequently open companies and have also cultivated a group of "nominal persons".

;

;"The threshold for foreigners to open a company alone in Singapore is relatively high." Wang Jian, director of Singapore DMC Consulting Company, explained to Southern Weekend reporters that without an Entrepreneurship Pass (Enter When a foreigner holding a business license opens a company, he or she must have a Singaporean or Singapore permanent resident as a director or secretary of the company. "Currently, Singapore has no restrictions on the number of locals who can serve as nominee directors and legal secretaries."

;

;In the records of the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority, there are 20 "nominee persons" "It's related to the suspect's company.

;

;These "nominee persons" serve as secretaries, shareholders, and directors of hundreds of companies continuously.

;

;"They asked me to invest and take care of their company. But I never got a penny and I don't have any shares." A 41-year-old Singaporean originally from Shanghai Wang Yuan told The Straits Times.

;

;Some money laundering gangs will also "tempt" regular companies to "act as shells" to launder money on their behalf.

;

;Yue Siqiu, a native of Sanming, Fujian, has been doing business in Singapore for 10 years. She has come into contact with money launderers in Singapore.

;

;"The other party wants to hire a member of their team in my company, and then use my company to buy a house. They will pay for the house purchase and give me 10 % remuneration." Yue Siqiu told Southern Weekend reporters that the other party targeted her company just because the company's accounts were clean and the bank would not suspect it.

;

;Yue Siqiu rejected the money launderer, but was harassed for a long time. "Because of the generous rewards, some Chinese businesses on Orchard Road will agree to these people's requests," she said.

;

;The 10 suspects hold a large amount of assets in their names. As of October 3, the Singapore police had issued prohibition orders on as many as 152 real estate properties. The prohibited properties belong to the suspects, their spouses or their companies, including 7 single-family bungalows in Sentosa Cove, 79 apartments (19 of which are still under construction) and 19 pieces of commercial land.

;

;"It can be said that there are as many ways to launder money as there are ways to make money." Yan Lixin told Southern Weekend reporters, "Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies Currency, gold, jewelry, precious metals, luxury goods, collectibles, etc. are often used as tools for money laundering because of their small size, high value, easy portability or transportation, and easy liquidation."

;

;In recent years, many real estate professionals have come into contact with "tycoons" who spend a lot of money. Singaporean real estate agent Tian Xin confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that he has sold high-end apartments and single-family houses to Fujian residents in Singapore. "Some rich people with a southern Fujian accent can buy two or three houses from me at once."

;

;As long as there is a team of accountants and lawyers to do a good job in bookkeeping, the money laundering behavior of real estate can be concealed. "If you encounter a bank asking about the source of funds, as long as the fake accounts are done perfectly, you can be deceived." A real estate agent told Singapore's Lianhe Zaobao.

;

;Among the luxury goods seized by the Singapore police from the suspect's house, there are many luxury cars, watches, famous paintings and trendy building blocks.

;

;For example, a Mercedes-Benz AMG luxury car priced at SGD 500,000; a Patek Philippe platinum astronomical tourbillon watch worth SGD 8 million; multiple bottles of 30 Years of Maotai and 100 bottles of Macallan whiskey...

;

;;Making money in Cambodia, living in Singapore? ;

;

;;Southern Weekend reporters sorted out the information of the 10 suspects and found that most of them are from Anxi County, Fujian Province, and spent their early years in the Philippines, Cambodia and other countries. Open an online gambling park and engage in online fraud business. ;

;

;Most of their "black money" is obtained through illegal online gambling and Internet fraud in countries such as Cambodia and the Philippines.

;

;Subsequently, they forged documents and transferred their illegal gains into Singapore through banks in Singapore, where they purchased and rented multiple luxury properties, luxury cars and luxury goods.

;

;42-year-old Wang Shuiming is the suspect with the highest total assets in the money laundering case. He was accused of forging documents, possessing illegal loan proceeds, etc. He holds passports from Turkey, China and Vanuatu.

;

;The Singapore court revealed that Wang Shuiming’s assets in Singapore exceed S$200 million, while his assets in other countries are about S$35.5 million, of which Cambodia’s assets are as high as S$24.53 million. SGD. Ong Shui Ming owns 11 apartments in Singapore, ten of which are located in Canninghill Piers, which faces the mountains and the sea, and the other is a Park Nova apartment on Thomson Road, Orchard Road.

;

;;

;

;Park Nova Apartment at Tong Lin Sang Road, Orchard Road. ;(Lou Xiaoxi/Photo);

;

;According to Cambodian government records, Wang Shuiming, Su Baolin, Su Jianfeng and The four of them, Su Wenqiang, obtained citizenship in 2019. The other five people all became Cambodian citizens between August 2018 and March 2021.

;

;While they obtained their status, they lived in Singapore most of the time.

;

;"The suspects became Cambodian citizens one after another, and other Chinese people were naturalized at the same time. Most of these people were the 'heads behind the scenes' of Cambodian online gambling companies. ” believes the nonprofit Internet Fraud Watch.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters asked many Chinese people living in Cambodia. Many of them could recognize Su Baolin and Su Haijin, and some people had "dealt with" Wang Shuiming. .

;

;"Wang Shuiming is a well-known Fujianese in Cambodia's online gambling circle. More than 90% of Chinese people in Cambodia know him." Lu Zeyuan, who lives in Cambodia, told Southern Weekend reporter also called Wang Shuiming a "character".

;

;Ten years ago, Wang Shuiming started his business by relying on gambling websites in the Philippines. He was one of the first batch of Fujianese to open online gambling in the Philippines.

;

;At its peak, Wang Shuiming had 10,000 employees. After accumulating funds in the Philippines, Wang Shuiming went to Cambodia to expand online gambling business.

;

;Cambodian Chinese media person Lin Xiao told Southern Weekend reporters that Wang Shuiming entered the online gambling industry early. The fund disk "Dafa System" developed by their team is used by online gambling companies in Cambodia, Myanmar, Dubai and other places. This system is "relatively fair and will not 'kill pigs' easily."

;

;Generally, online gambling companies regard participating online gamblers as "pigs". When gamblers recharge in large amounts, the company's backend will be locked Gamblers' account funds are cut off from them to achieve the purpose of "killing pigs".

;

;Southern Weekend reporters checked the industrial and commercial information of Cambodia and Singapore and found that Wang Shuiming is the chairman of Cambodia’s Daming IT Services Company and is also an outstanding figure in Singapore. Director and shareholder of Zhuo Chi Technology. The above-mentioned companies all claim to be “mainly engaged in software development”.

;

;Wang Shuiming is also one of the eight directors of Cambodian SCWD Construction Company. The company was registered in 2016. The company letters correspond to the directors’ surnames: Su, Chen, Wang, Deng.

;

;Wang Dehai, another suspect in this money laundering case, is also one of the eight directors of SCWD Construction.

;

;On August 15, Wang Dehai was arrested at an apartment near Paterson Hill on Orchard Road and charged with money laundering. Singapore police found more than S$2.2 million in cash, 35 luxury watches, 51 pieces of jewelry and several designer bags in his apartment.

;

;Lv Zeyuan has lived in Cambodia for nearly ten years. He told Southern Weekend reporters that after the Internet fraud business became big, the bosses behind the scenes set up offices in the Philippines, Malaysia, and Thailand. Companies, some "big bosses" even have private jets.

;

;"These people ultimately prefer to go to Singapore to change their lives." Lu Zeyuan said.

;

;But the online gambling boss living in Singapore will not stop his online fraud business in Southeast Asia.

;

;"These online gambling company owners will manage the company's affairs remotely. They may fly to Cambodia two or three times a year and only deal with major matters. Small matters will be left to the general manager of the park." Lin. Xiao told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;“Almost the entire village is in Singapore”

;

;The Fujian Gang in Singapore was also exposed with the money laundering case.

;

;"The Hokkien gang in Singapore ranges from dozens to hundreds. Among them, gangs are divided according to their surnames. Su, Wang, Hu and Chen are the major ones. The main gang," an anonymous real estate agent told Singapore's Lianhe Zaobao.

;

;Su Haijin and another suspect Wang Dehai are considered to be the bosses of two gangs surnamed Su and Wang.

;

;Singapore’s Fujian Gang has always been generous. "They usually live a high-profile life, driving Lamborghinis, Ferraris, etc., and when they go to high-end nightclubs to spend money, they are accompanied by Chinese girls."

;

;Fujian gangs attach great importance to geography and clan. Guanxi, prefer small circle culture.

;

;A friend of Lin Xiao lives in the same village as Wang Shuiming. "They have a small circle culture. He helps Wang Shuiming act as an agent (for fraud). They will make a list themselves." , the villagers play by themselves." Lin Xiao told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;At the end of September 2023, Su Haijin’s defense lawyer Zheng Huilong stated in court that Su Haijin’s four children, his parents, father-in-law and mother-in-law, and even several Brothers, sisters and relatives are all in Singapore. "Almost their entire village is in Singapore."

;

;"The Fujian Gang likes to find outstanding young men as lobbyists and invite local Chinese to meet and discuss cooperation." Liu Yanan, a Chinese from Singapore, told Southern Weekend reporters that he was The lobbyist invited me several times, "but I didn't agree."

;

;The Singapore government has adopted a "zero tolerance" attitude towards this money laundering case.

;

;In mid-September, Singapore’s Minister of Home Affairs and Law Shanmugam said in an interview with Singapore’s Lianhe Zaobao that anyone who does anything illegal in Singapore, or If you do illegal business overseas and try to launder money in Singapore, they will take action.

;

;On September 29, 2023, when Wang Shuiming appeared in court for the third time, a Singaporean judge rejected him on the grounds that he "may abscond" and "collude with other suspects." bail application.

;

;Wang Shuiming and many other suspects in money laundering cases have criminal records in China and are fugitives in the country.

;

;In May 2022, the Public Security Bureau of Boshan District, Zibo City, Shandong Province cracked a "Hengbo Bao.com Gambling Case" and arrested criminal suspects of opening gambling websites and making illegal profits. 131 people were arrested, and more than 10 million yuan of funds involved in the case were recovered. Wang Shuiming is the most wanted person recorded by the Boshan District Public Security Bureau.

;

;There are still nine people involved in the above cases who are illegally staying abroad. Except for Wang Shuiming, the other eight people are all from Anxi County, Fujian, and most of them have the surname Wang.

;

;Wang Dehai, the leader of the Fujian gang surnamed Wang, was wanted by the Guiyang County Public Security Bureau in Hunan Province at the B level in 2018 for being suspected of an online gambling case. Also wanted at the same time were Su Jianfeng and Su Wenqiang in this money laundering case.

;

;Singapore court investigation found that Wang Dehai joined a gambling company from the Philippines in 2012 and gradually expanded the business from customer service to promotion. Currently, the gambling website where Wang Dehai worked before is still in operation.

;

;;

;

;The Marq on Paterson Hill condominium on Orchard Road. The place where money laundering suspect Wang Dehai was arrested. ;(Lou Xiaoxi/Photo);

;

;"The ten suspects belong to a larger criminal group, and they are inextricably linked to each other. Contact." In September 2023, the Singapore Police Commercial Affairs Department (CAD), which is responsible for money laundering cases, admitted in a court affidavit.

;

;Currently, the Singapore police have not discovered any business connections between Wang Baosen and the other nine suspects. However, Wang Baosen’s name has long been associated with Southeast Asian fraud gangs.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters checked the judgment document website and found that as early as 2013, Wang Baosen joined the Philippine "Hongli International" online gambling website established by Wang Bin, a native of Anxi, Fujian. , responsible for financial work. 2014年网站团队迁入柬埔寨边境城市巴域（越南称木排），随后王宝森逐渐负责鸿利国际网站的全面管理工作，底薪为1万元人民币，另有奖金提成。

;

;该网站涉赌资金高达9.8亿元人民币。

;

;除了被指控的10名嫌疑人，目前还有多人正协助新加坡警方调查，包括企业服务提供商、房地产经纪和金融机构等。

;

;2023年8月28日，新加坡律政部向宝石和贵金属经销商发出的一份34人审查名单中，王宝森的妻子何惠芳、“鸿利国际”网站创始人王斌刚赫然在列。该审查名单旨在提醒宝石经销商及时通报可疑交易。

;

;案件不断发酵，9月初新加坡法庭宣誓书显示，王宝森一位表兄弟的1亿资金被冻结，此人已逃出新加坡。

;

;为了在他国生活，嫌疑人多持有多国护照。新加坡法庭10月18日揭露，唯一一名女性嫌疑人林宝英曾分别支付13万美元和16万美元，购买了多米尼克和柬埔寨的护照。

;

;“小国家护照可以通过移民中介买到，并不难获得。”新加坡DMC咨询公司董事王俭告诉南方周末记者，洗钱案曝光后，新加坡就推出了一个政策，凡是拿着小国护照的中国人很难在银行开户、开设公司。

;

;“除非这些人可以出具放弃原籍证明。”王俭说。

;

;截至发稿日，10名嫌疑人仍在寻求法院保释。

;

;新加坡法律规定，犯有洗钱罪的人可被判处最高10年监禁、最高50万新元的罚款，或两者并罚。

;

;尚穆根坦言，10名洗钱案被告一旦治罪，将在新加坡服刑，服完刑期后遣送回他所持护照的国家，或被送回跟新加坡有引渡协议的国家。

;

;而中国与新加坡没有引渡协议。

;10月18日，云南省弥勒市佛城商都发生电梯坠落事故。截至目前，共造成3人死亡，4人重伤、13人轻伤。 23日，云南省人民政府办公室工作人员告诉南都记者，该事故已被提级调查，由云南省市场监督管理局负责。该工作人员还称，当前伤者状态趋于稳定。云南省市监局工作人员表示已派人前往事发地进行调查。

;

;;

;

;;事故现场。 ;

;

;事故现场视频显示，事故现场有救护车、消防车等，医生、消防员在一栋楼下搬运担架，多名市民在现场围观。

;

;18日，据弥勒市政府新闻办发布通告，当天12时许，弥勒市佛城商都发生电梯坠落。弥勒市立即组织力量全力救治伤员，截至目前，共造成3人死亡，4人重伤、13人轻伤。坠落原因调查等工作正在紧张开展中。

;

;23日，南都记者从云南省人民政府获知，该事故已被提级调查，由云南省市场监督管理局负责。云南省市监局表示已派工作人员前往事发地，调查工作正在开展。此外，云南省人民政府办公室工作人员告诉南都记者，当前伤者状态趋于稳定。

;

;云南省特种设备安全技术协会工作人员向南都记者表示，“按规定来说，货梯客梯不能混用。”

;

;今日是农历九月初九，又是一年重阳佳节。

;

;;重阳节又称“重九”，因为在《易经》中把“六”定为阴数，把“九”定为阳数，九月九日，日月并阳，两九相重，故称“重阳”，又称“重九”。;

;

;关于重阳节，唐代诗人王维九月九登高时写下的《九月九日忆山东兄弟》;我们都耳熟能详，登高望远、祭祖、佩茱萸则是我们熟知的重阳习俗。而经过两千多年的变迁，重阳节还伴随着其他形式多样的习俗活动。;

;

;;登高、祭祖;

;

;;重阳最重要的活动之一，即是登高，故重阳节又叫“;;登高节;;”。九月初九秋意渐浓，天高气爽，正是适合远眺美景、登山健身之时。而重阳节与除夕、清明、中元节三节，为中国传统四大祭祖节日。;

;

;;;尊老敬老;;

;

;因“九”是数字中的最大数，是久长久远的谐音。九九重阳含有长长久久，长寿多福的寓意，;1989年，我国把每年农历九月九日定为老人节，提倡尊老、爱老、敬老、助老。;

;

;;除此之外，;插茱萸、簪菊、赏菊、饮菊花酒，放风筝，食重阳糕;;也都是比较常见的民间习俗。

;
